+/**

+class FilePropertiesStack {
+
+  // TODO perhaps use a fixed size list here

nodes.bodyText: How about permissions = properties.getFilePermissions.orElse(permissions)? Or, how about just declaring the field as Optional and assign them directly? (The getter return types can remain @Nullable though.)
OrElse has a nice flow to it.

I usually pay special attention to String or collections when combined with Optional, as they can be empty. Is it guaranteed that user is a non-empty string (if present)? Otherwise, it's possible that a lower stack has, say, "1234" and a higher "" (empty string), resulting in clearing "1234".
Right, so something I didn't include in this PR was enforcing empty in the json parser. I have that in a separate branch. But basically empty items will not be allowed.

So if a lower stack had user=1234 but a higher stack group=5678, it will lose 1234. Probably this is what we intend, but I just wanted to confirm. Maybe good to have a test to formalize the intention.
I'm not sure I understand, the ownership calculation is outside the loop. So once group and user are finalized, then the values are converted into an ownership string.

Ah, I misunderstood. Yeah, the calculation is outside the loop.
Just so you know, jib-core will probably accept : (a single colon) as an ownership string, but I think it makes sense to return null as done here when both user and group are null.
These don't seem necessary. In updateProperties(), you always start with null. These can be local to the method.
Yeah, I can't remember why I did this, good catch.
super nit: could be useful to add inline comments for these parameters? like /*filePermissions=*/ etc.

In general we avoid these kind of comments. Usually that kind of information is provided by IDE, you can quickly determine what each parameter is. And adding those, can sometimes make it harder to read the code.
